description: Those looking to complete the Apple Certified Support Professional (ACSP) certification will find in this course an overview of the process involved in achieving the certification and details about the exam required to pass in order to receive the certification. The certification is designed for technicians working in business environments supporting Apple computers and confirms one understands OS X's core functionality. Viewers will learn in this course tactics like basic installation and configuration of OS X Yosemite, managing user accounts, file systems used by Mac OS, enforcing policy across a network, data management, applications and processes, network configurations, and system management and security.
name: Certified Support Professional 10.10
subtitle: OS X Support Essentials 10.10

episodes.description: The ACSP certification is for businesses when they deploy Macs for the use of basic installation, security, policy enforcement and for the purpose of getting Macs to interact with non-Apple operating systems. Viewers will hear an overview about the knowledge one needs to attain the ACSP certification, about the OS X Support Essentials Exam and the exam objectives of topics one should know for the exam.
episodes.title: ACSP 10.10 Overview
episodes.transcript:
1
00:00:00,000 --> 00:00:08,381
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:08,381 --> 00:00:10,346
In this segment we're gonna take a look

3
00:00:10,346 --> 00:00:13,096
at the Apple Certified
Support Professional or ACSP.

4
00:00:13,096 --> 00:00:16,656
The ACSP certification has been around for
quite awhile with Apple and

5
00:00:16,656 --> 00:00:17,622
it's designed for

6
00:00:17,622 --> 00:00:22,320
technicians that are working in business
environments where you're supporting.

7
00:00:22,320 --> 00:00:25,950
Apple computers, right, be they laptops,
or desktops mostly, but

8
00:00:25,950 --> 00:00:29,520
a little bit of mobile, iPad,
iPhone type environments, but for

9
00:00:29,520 --> 00:00:33,490
the most part we're focusing on
the Mac OS ten side of things,

10
00:00:33,490 --> 00:00:37,130
right, that operating system that we
still run on laptops and desktops.

11
00:00:38,180 --> 00:00:40,640
ACSP is not really designed for
a home user, right,

12
00:00:40,640 --> 00:00:44,180
just a person who's got a single Mac or
couple Mac's home and that's it.

13
00:00:44,180 --> 00:00:45,790
We're really talking about businesses.

14
00:00:45,790 --> 00:00:49,820
What do businesses go through
when they deploy Macs, right?

15
00:00:49,820 --> 00:00:52,100
And it kind of boils down
to two different things.

16
00:00:52,100 --> 00:00:56,370
One is just supporting the native
environment inside of Mac OS ten and

17
00:00:56,370 --> 00:01:01,640
then the other side is getting it to
interact with non-Apple operating systems.

18
00:01:01,640 --> 00:01:03,520
If you've got Linux systems or

19
00:01:03,520 --> 00:01:06,942
Microsoft Windows system, you gotta
get the two to talk to each other.

20
00:01:06,942 --> 00:01:11,790
The ACSP is a nice certification
that covers a lot of that.

21
00:01:11,790 --> 00:01:15,210
From basic installation which is where
we're gonna start, all the way up

22
00:01:15,210 --> 00:01:20,050
to more advanced things like security and
enforcing policy across your network.

23
00:01:20,050 --> 00:01:24,530
It's a really cool certification,
covers really practical skills.

24
00:01:24,530 --> 00:01:27,110
All too often we see technical
certification that are out there that

25
00:01:27,110 --> 00:01:29,740
cover things that are Esoteric, or

26
00:01:29,740 --> 00:01:33,070
things that you aren't going to
implement in real life land very much.

27
00:01:33,070 --> 00:01:37,220
But this one, the ACSP, covers real
world activities that you can expect to

28
00:01:37,220 --> 00:01:41,640
perform if you're supporting
Apple devices in your network.

29
00:01:41,640 --> 00:01:43,938
The exam itself is pretty straightforward.

30
00:01:43,938 --> 00:01:46,750
What we're gonna be doing
in this IT Pro TV series,

31
00:01:46,750 --> 00:01:52,410
is covering all of the exam objectives
that are covered on the actual ACSP exam.

32
00:01:52,410 --> 00:01:55,310
Now before I jump into those objectives,
let's talk a little bit about that exam.

33
00:01:56,330 --> 00:01:59,000
Unlike the entry level
Apple certifications,

34
00:01:59,000 --> 00:02:03,050
like the Apple Certified Associate or
ACA, those certifications.

35
00:02:03,050 --> 00:02:06,350
Those, you could take those exams at
a Pearsonvue center anywhere you wanted.

36
00:02:06,350 --> 00:02:08,220
You could actually take
them from your desktop.

37
00:02:08,220 --> 00:02:10,820
You can just go online and take the exam.

38
00:02:10,820 --> 00:02:11,610
For this one.

39
00:02:11,610 --> 00:02:17,010
For ACSP, you have to take it at
an Apple-authorized training center,

40
00:02:17,010 --> 00:02:19,290
an AATC, all right?

41
00:02:19,290 --> 00:02:21,790
You've gotta locate an AATC near you.

42
00:02:21,790 --> 00:02:24,855
Now, most of the AATCs do run the course.

43
00:02:24,855 --> 00:02:26,435
Course for this certification.

44
00:02:26,435 --> 00:02:30,345
The official course, if you wanna take it,
is the Yosemite 101 course.

45
00:02:30,345 --> 00:02:32,674
Before that it was the Mavericks 101.

46
00:02:32,674 --> 00:02:35,435
They always name it after
the OS it's based on.

47
00:02:35,435 --> 00:02:39,387
It's a great course, it takes usually
five days, and you take it in the AATC.

48
00:02:39,387 --> 00:02:43,705
We're gonna cover the same exact content
here, the advantage being you can do it at

49
00:02:43,705 --> 00:02:47,000
your own pace, and get ready for
the exam the same way.

50
00:02:47,000 --> 00:02:51,140
But either way, whether you do the
official course or you watch our shows,

51
00:02:51,140 --> 00:02:55,650
if you wanna get the certification,
you've got to take the test at an AATC,

52
00:02:55,650 --> 00:02:58,190
we don't have any way to
administer that to you guys.

53
00:02:58,190 --> 00:03:00,830
You've got to locate one that's near you,
if you're like me, the nearest one is

54
00:03:00,830 --> 00:03:03,730
about two hours away, so I've got
to hop in the car and drive a bit.

55
00:03:03,730 --> 00:03:06,040
But you go down there and
you can take the exam.

56
00:03:06,040 --> 00:03:09,730
The exam is a multiple place exam,
for the most part.

57
00:03:09,730 --> 00:03:13,250
There are some drag and drop and
some what are called hot spot questions,

58
00:03:13,250 --> 00:03:15,980
where they show you a picture and
you have to click on an area.

59
00:03:15,980 --> 00:03:19,330
Click on the icon that will take you to a
utility that can perform this action, and

60
00:03:19,330 --> 00:03:20,440
you gotta click on the right icon.

61
00:03:20,440 --> 00:03:21,060
That kind of thing.

62
00:03:22,150 --> 00:03:24,440
Drag and drop will be,
here's a list of events,

63
00:03:24,440 --> 00:03:26,490
drag them and put them in the right order.

64
00:03:26,490 --> 00:03:30,780
It's pretty straightforward questions,
no real trick questions, or anything.

65
00:03:30,780 --> 00:03:31,680
You know what you need to do.

66
00:03:31,680 --> 00:03:32,870
You answer the question.

67
00:03:32,870 --> 00:03:34,170
And you move on.

68
00:03:34,170 --> 00:03:36,810
It is a big exam.

69
00:03:36,810 --> 00:03:39,500
It's 80 questions or around 80 questions.

70
00:03:39,500 --> 00:03:43,800
And you get two hours to do it in, so
that's about a minute and a half per

71
00:03:43,800 --> 00:03:47,530
question, which is a pretty decent amount
of time, if you know what you're doing.

72
00:03:47,530 --> 00:03:50,840
If you know the content, you won't have
any problem finishing in time, but

73
00:03:50,840 --> 00:03:54,900
if you have to deliberate on a lot of the
questions, you'll run out of time fast and

74
00:03:54,900 --> 00:03:58,890
that's unfortunate because any question
you don't get to is marked wrong, right?

75
00:03:58,890 --> 00:04:00,350
You don't get credit for those questions.

76
00:04:01,370 --> 00:04:03,500
All right, as far as taking the exam.

77
00:04:03,500 --> 00:04:06,580
Finding your local AATC,
that's a big part of it.

78
00:04:06,580 --> 00:04:08,140
And you can go to Apple's website and

79
00:04:08,140 --> 00:04:10,320
they have where you can
pull that information up.

80
00:04:10,320 --> 00:04:12,720
In fact, if you haven't been
to Apple's website yet,

81
00:04:12,720 --> 00:04:15,930
that's a great place to start
learning about this certification.

82
00:04:15,930 --> 00:04:20,233
You can go to
training.Apple.com/certification,

83
00:04:20,233 --> 00:04:21,070
all right?

84
00:04:21,070 --> 00:04:24,220
That'll take you to the certification
page, and you'll find in there where

85
00:04:24,220 --> 00:04:28,260
they've got certifications for creative
professionals like graphics design.

86
00:04:28,260 --> 00:04:32,526
And IT Professionals and,
they've got the Maverick 10.9 and

87
00:04:32,526 --> 00:04:36,040
the Yosemite 10.10 certifications up now.

88
00:04:36,040 --> 00:04:39,800
The Yosemite stuff at the time of
this taping is not all done yet.

89
00:04:39,800 --> 00:04:41,940
They're still in the works of creating it.

90
00:04:41,940 --> 00:04:43,300
But as soon as it's all done,

91
00:04:43,300 --> 00:04:46,910
they'll phase out the 10.9 certifications
and you'll see that go away.

92
00:04:46,910 --> 00:04:49,870
If you go to the webpage and you don't
see 10.9 don't don't be surprised.

93
00:04:51,130 --> 00:04:54,510
Now, when we go into 10.10, you'll
see a few of the certifications that

94
00:04:54,510 --> 00:04:56,910
are available, and
they're only listing three.

95
00:04:56,910 --> 00:04:57,890
There's actually four.

96
00:04:57,890 --> 00:05:00,370
The fourth one's not done as of today.

97
00:05:00,370 --> 00:05:04,980
There's the Apple Certified Associate for
Mac Management Basics, which is for

98
00:05:04,980 --> 00:05:08,260
just the basic administration
of an Apple device.

99
00:05:08,260 --> 00:05:10,370
That exam is really straightforward, and

100

if you're just getting started with this,
that's really where you should start.

101
00:05:14,530 --> 00:05:18,470
Here at IT Pro TV, we've already taped the
series from Mac Management Basics, we did

102
00:05:18,470 --> 00:05:25,030
it for 10.9, but there's no significant
changes to that exam from 10.9 to 10.10.

103
00:05:25,030 --> 00:05:29,690
If you study the 10.9 material, you can
take either the 10.9 or the 10.10 exam and

104
00:05:29,690 --> 00:05:31,000
you'll do just fine.

105
00:05:31,000 --> 00:05:33,720
It's an inexpensive exam,
it's $65 to take it.

106
00:05:33,720 --> 00:05:34,930
And you can take it.

107
00:05:34,930 --> 00:05:37,680
From your own desk you don't
have to travel anywhere, so

108
00:05:37,680 --> 00:05:41,410
if your just getting started with Apple
that's really where you should start,

109
00:05:41,410 --> 00:05:46,210
all right, the Apple Certified Associate
for Mac integration,

110
00:05:46,210 --> 00:05:50,140
that's getting your Macs to work
together with Windows machines.

111
00:05:50,140 --> 00:05:52,010
There's a lot of Microsoft Windows
machines out there in

112
00:05:52,010 --> 00:05:54,550
business environments.

113
00:05:54,550 --> 00:05:56,290
You need to get them to
talk to each other and

114
00:05:56,290 --> 00:05:59,410
exchange information and that's all that
what that certification is all about.

115
00:05:59,410 --> 00:06:00,970
It covers some really great stuff.

116
00:06:00,970 --> 00:06:02,490
Again, we've already taped that series.

117
00:06:02,490 --> 00:06:04,080
We did it under 10.9,

118
00:06:04,080 --> 00:06:08,240
but no significant changes, there's a few
little things that have been added.

119
00:06:08,240 --> 00:06:11,230
We're actually going to record some extra
videos to correct for those, but for

120
00:06:11,230 --> 00:06:16,780
the most part it's the same, next is the
Apple Certified Support Professional and

121
00:06:16,780 --> 00:06:19,480
that's this series that you're
about to watch, all right.

122
00:06:19,480 --> 00:06:22,710
That's the first of the upper
level certifications.

123
00:06:22,710 --> 00:06:25,230
These are where things start to
get a lot harder, all right.

124
00:06:25,230 --> 00:06:27,080
These first two exams,
they're pretty easy.

125
00:06:27,080 --> 00:06:31,830
Most people should be able to study and
pass those exams in about a week really.

126
00:06:31,830 --> 00:06:34,960
If you watch the series and
hit the book, and

127
00:06:34,960 --> 00:06:37,380
the book is free you can
download it right from.

128
00:06:37,380 --> 00:06:37,920
Their website.

129
00:06:37,920 --> 00:06:39,640
That's the book for
those guys right there.

130
00:06:39,640 --> 00:06:43,530
You can download it, study, it should take
you a week, maybe two weeks to get ready,

131
00:06:43,530 --> 00:06:45,880
get those certifications and
have them on your resume.

132
00:06:45,880 --> 00:06:48,530
But for
the the ASCP it's a lot more material.

133
00:06:48,530 --> 00:06:49,980
It's a big exam.

134
00:06:49,980 --> 00:06:51,630
It's a ton of information.

135
00:06:51,630 --> 00:06:54,190
And this one's gonna require
a lot more work, all right?

136
00:06:54,190 --> 00:06:57,260
If you're just getting started,
start with these two guys here,.

137
00:06:57,260 --> 00:06:58,300
There's a lot of overlap.

138
00:06:58,300 --> 00:07:01,660
The things that you learn here,
you'll see again, is ACSP, so

139
00:07:01,660 --> 00:07:04,030
having that under your belt, already
having that knowledge is pretty handy.

140
00:07:04,030 --> 00:07:07,260
Now, there's another
level up above this one.

141
00:07:07,260 --> 00:07:09,340
The ACTC, that's not showing up here.

142
00:07:09,340 --> 00:07:12,260
That's an Apple Certified
Technical Coordinator.

143
00:07:12,260 --> 00:07:16,160
And the only reason it's not showing
up is the 10.10 version is not out yet.

144
00:07:16,160 --> 00:07:20,070
If I go back to the 10.9 page,
you'll see the ACTC right there.

145
00:07:20,070 --> 00:07:20,660
All right?

146
00:07:20,660 --> 00:07:24,790
I'm gonna use this page for a minute just
to kind of show you guys how this works,

147
00:07:24,790 --> 00:07:29,940
but basically,
the ACSP is where you start, all right.

148
00:07:29,940 --> 00:07:34,100
The earlier exams, the ACA's,
those are not prerequisites.

149
00:07:34,100 --> 00:07:37,950
You don't have to do those, if you
don't wanna do the ACA's, fine, don't.

150
00:07:37,950 --> 00:07:39,450
Just skip right past them.

151
00:07:39,450 --> 00:07:42,640
If you already have that knowledge and
you're ready to move up to the next level,

152
00:07:42,640 --> 00:07:45,770
then you don't have to bother with it,
I encourage people to do it but,

153
00:07:45,770 --> 00:07:46,520
it's not a requirement.

154
00:07:48,080 --> 00:07:51,880
Then, the ACSP, that's that first step for
the higher level certification.

155
00:07:51,880 --> 00:07:56,430
It's one show or this series that
we're about to do and one exam.

156
00:07:56,430 --> 00:08:01,885
The exam is the OS 10 or OS X Support,
the Essentials 10.10 exam.

157
00:08:01,885 --> 00:08:03,856
It says, 10.9.

158
00:08:03,856 --> 00:08:05,000
And, it tells you right there.

159
00:08:05,000 --> 00:08:07,130
Available only at Apple-authorized
training centers.

160
00:08:07,130 --> 00:08:08,040
And if you click on that link,

161
00:08:08,040 --> 00:08:10,740
it will take you where you
can find a one near you.

162
00:08:10,740 --> 00:08:13,620
Now they do have the official
Mavericks 101 course, but

163
00:08:13,620 --> 00:08:17,670
this is what I wanted to point you guys to
right here, the Exam Preparation Guide.

164
00:08:17,670 --> 00:08:22,700
The Exam Prep Guide has a lot of
information to get you ready for the exam.

165
00:08:22,700 --> 00:08:27,542
And the main thing is let me go back to
10.10 here we go the main thing is when we

166
00:08:27,542 --> 00:08:31,958
go to that Exam Prep Guide, it's a PDF,
your machine will download it and

167
00:08:31,958 --> 00:08:33,870
you'll pull it up here.

168
00:08:33,870 --> 00:08:36,000
It'll tell you what to expect on the exam.

169
00:08:36,000 --> 00:08:37,790
A lot of the stuff that I've
been saying right here,

170
00:08:37,790 --> 00:08:41,090
that you've got the entry-level certs,
and the higher-level certs.

171
00:08:41,090 --> 00:08:45,480
It'll tell you in here how many
questions the exam is, 80 questions,

172
00:08:45,480 --> 00:08:48,680
you've got to score a 73% to pass.

173
00:08:48,680 --> 00:08:52,010
General information that you'll
want to know to be prepared.

174
00:08:52,010 --> 00:08:55,370
But the most important
part is right down here.

175
00:08:55,370 --> 00:08:57,040
Where it goes into the exam objectives.

176
00:08:58,140 --> 00:09:02,370
The exam, is broken up across
eight different knowledge areas.

177
00:09:02,370 --> 00:09:04,350
Part one is installation and
configuration.

178
00:09:04,350 --> 00:09:06,910
What does it take just
to install Yosemite, and

179
00:09:06,910 --> 00:09:08,990
do a basic configuration to get it up and
operational?

180
00:09:08,990 --> 00:09:10,470
That's the first part.

181
00:09:10,470 --> 00:09:13,340
And then they list all
the things you should know.

182
00:09:13,340 --> 00:09:14,460
Read through these.

183
00:09:14,460 --> 00:09:16,130
Do you already know all of these?

184
00:09:16,130 --> 00:09:18,400
If you already know how to
do all of these things,

185
00:09:18,400 --> 00:09:20,530
then you can skip past this section and
go to the next one.

186
00:09:20,530 --> 00:09:22,860
Or if you need a refresher,
if you don't know some of these things,

187
00:09:22,860 --> 00:09:23,840
then go ahead and watch it.

188
00:09:23,840 --> 00:09:26,210
Watch that show or a couple of shows and

189
00:09:26,210 --> 00:09:29,070
we'll cover that content
as we move through it.

190
00:09:29,070 --> 00:09:31,420
After that it starts to
move into other areas.

191
00:09:31,420 --> 00:09:33,470
Like, if I can scroll down and find it.

192
00:09:33,470 --> 00:09:35,680
They have like some review and
practice questions too,

193
00:09:35,680 --> 00:09:37,880
which is kind of nice if
you're getting ready.

194
00:09:37,880 --> 00:09:39,170
Part two is user accounts.

195
00:09:39,170 --> 00:09:41,940
We start breaking down the different
types of user accounts in Mac OS,

196
00:09:41,940 --> 00:09:44,520
and how to create them,
how to disable them.

197
00:09:44,520 --> 00:09:47,990
And all the various things that
are involved in managing that.

198
00:09:47,990 --> 00:09:51,770
Now, when we talk about managing user
accounts, they might be local accounts,

199
00:09:51,770 --> 00:09:53,400
on your individual machine, but

200
00:09:53,400 --> 00:09:58,280
they might also be network accounts
on a machine that running OSX server.

201
00:09:58,280 --> 00:10:00,650
There's different types of accounts
that you need to be aware of.

202
00:10:00,650 --> 00:10:02,460
And then there's also some underlying,

203
00:10:02,460 --> 00:10:04,270
hidden accounts like
the root user account.

204
00:10:04,270 --> 00:10:06,650
We talk about those,
it's pretty good stuff, right?

205
00:10:06,650 --> 00:10:08,840
Things that you will
encounter in real life.

206
00:10:08,840 --> 00:10:10,350
And so it breaks all those down.

207
00:10:10,350 --> 00:10:13,290
And you start to see that information,
now for the ACSP,

208
00:10:13,290 --> 00:10:18,010
you don't see a lot of server items right?

209
00:10:18,010 --> 00:10:21,290
We'll mention that yeah there's user
accounts if you have OSX server.

210
00:10:21,290 --> 00:10:23,125
But we're gonna work with the local.

211
00:10:23,125 --> 00:10:24,335
Couple of accounts here in ACSP.

212
00:10:25,355 --> 00:10:29,465
For those of you moving to the next level,
the Apple Certified Technical Coordinator,

213
00:10:29,465 --> 00:10:32,225
that's where the server
information comes in.

214
00:10:32,225 --> 00:10:37,243
And let me go back to that page
that was the, the 10.9 page.

215
00:10:37,243 --> 00:10:41,675
I'm just gonna jump back to that one to
show you guys how these stack together.

216
00:10:41,675 --> 00:10:45,400
The ACA, that was not a prerequisite.

217
00:10:45,400 --> 00:10:47,860
Forgetting the ACSP.

218
00:10:47,860 --> 00:10:50,800
You don't have to do the ACA's,
you can skip past them, and do the ACSP.

219
00:10:52,010 --> 00:10:54,500
But if you want your
Apple Certified Technical Coordinator,

220
00:10:54,500 --> 00:10:59,350
if you want to get the ACTC,
you have to get the ACSP first.

221
00:10:59,350 --> 00:11:02,580
The ACSP is that first step on
that advanced level certification.

222
00:11:02,580 --> 00:11:03,760
You've got to do the ACSP first.

223
00:11:04,800 --> 00:11:07,450
Once you've passed it,
then you do the ACTC.

224
00:11:07,450 --> 00:11:09,840
And when you've passed both,

225
00:11:09,840 --> 00:11:13,330
that's when you're awarded
the Apple Certified Technical Coordinator.

226
00:11:13,330 --> 00:11:16,330
And if you look at the two courses,
you've got this Mavericks 101.

227
00:11:16,330 --> 00:11:18,022
And you've got the Mavericks 201.

228
00:11:18,022 --> 00:11:22,140
The 101 is what we're gonna
be covering here in ACSP.

229
00:11:22,140 --> 00:11:24,396
That's the.
The OSX Support Essentials, and

230
00:11:24,396 --> 00:11:26,925
we're doing 10.10, all right.

231
00:11:26,925 --> 00:11:31,685
The other one is OSX Server Essentials
10.10, all right.

232
00:11:31,685 --> 00:11:33,585
That's why we move the server stuff off.

233
00:11:33,585 --> 00:11:37,015
If you watch the ACSP show, and you're
like, man, that was a good show, but Don,

234
00:11:37,015 --> 00:11:39,265
you didn't cover any server stuff,
are you scared?

235
00:11:39,265 --> 00:11:41,215
Well, no, not scared, I promise.

236
00:11:41,215 --> 00:11:44,825
Well, maybe a little, but we moved it off
to another show, right, cuz it's covered

237
00:11:44,825 --> 00:11:48,700
in that OSX server essentials, so
that's what we're gonna tackle.

238
00:11:48,700 --> 00:11:50,970
The two combined, it's two exams.

239
00:11:50,970 --> 00:11:52,940
You pass them both and you get your ACTC.

240
00:11:52,940 --> 00:11:57,200
That's usually the certification
that people are reaching out for

241
00:11:57,200 --> 00:12:00,650
ACST looks good on your resume,
it'll help you get in and get that job.

242
00:12:00,650 --> 00:12:05,160
ACTC is when you really show that
you have expert level knowledge

243
00:12:05,160 --> 00:12:07,150
of implementing max in
a business environment.

244
00:12:07,150 --> 00:12:10,200
In a home environment,
you're not gonna have a server, but

245
00:12:10,200 --> 00:12:14,400
in a business environment, you will and
that server knowledge is really important

246
00:12:14,400 --> 00:12:18,470
and so that ACTC is a great
goal to reach out for, right?

247
00:12:18,470 --> 00:12:21,590
That's not what we're covering in
this show, we're doing ACSP, so

248
00:12:21,590 --> 00:12:23,820
let's talk a little bit about some of
the things that were covered in there.

249
00:12:23,820 --> 00:12:26,370
We are gonna talk about installation and
configuration, right?

250
00:12:26,370 --> 00:12:27,570
We already saw that.

251
00:12:27,570 --> 00:12:30,760
We are going to talk about,
user accounts, and the user accounts

252
00:12:30,760 --> 00:12:34,510
that are on the system, the pre-built ones
as well as ones that we make ourselves.

253
00:12:34,510 --> 00:12:37,500
We are gonna look at the file system,
that mac OS uses.

254
00:12:37,500 --> 00:12:40,370
As far as the Apple
supported ones like HFS,

255
00:12:40,370 --> 00:12:45,600
as well as third party ones like NTFS, and
CDFS, and we'll get a chance to see those.

256
00:12:45,600 --> 00:12:47,550
We're gonna take a look
at data management.

257
00:12:47,550 --> 00:12:51,490
As far as things that we can do with the
information we store on our hard drives.

258
00:12:51,490 --> 00:12:53,450
Yosemite introduced
some really cool stuff.

259
00:12:53,450 --> 00:12:54,970
Like universal tagging.

260
00:12:54,970 --> 00:12:56,890
And if you haven't used that yet
it's really cool.

261
00:12:56,890 --> 00:12:59,160
We'll get a chance to see some of those.

262
00:12:59,160 --> 00:13:02,590
We're gonna talk about applications and
processes.

263
00:13:02,590 --> 00:13:05,190
How do we install applications and
keep them updated.

264
00:13:05,190 --> 00:13:06,770
And how do we control the applications?

265
00:13:06,770 --> 00:13:08,240
If we have one start to run wild and

266
00:13:08,240 --> 00:13:11,050
eat up all of our CPU,
how do we even know that happens?

267
00:13:11,050 --> 00:13:13,640
We'll get a chance to see that and
how to with them.

268
00:13:13,640 --> 00:13:15,840
We're gonna do network configuration.

269
00:13:15,840 --> 00:13:16,500
In this day and

270
00:13:16,500 --> 00:13:19,900
age it's a rare computer that isn't
at least connected to the Internet.

271
00:13:19,900 --> 00:13:22,400
But more importantly, I wanna
connect your computers together, so

272
00:13:22,400 --> 00:13:23,990
they can exchange information.

273
00:13:23,990 --> 00:13:26,770
We'll get a chance to
see that in networking.

274
00:13:26,770 --> 00:13:29,060
We'll also see system management.

275
00:13:29,060 --> 00:13:32,290
System management ranges from
keeping our systems up to date,

276
00:13:32,290 --> 00:13:34,500
as well as controlling
their configuration.

277
00:13:34,500 --> 00:13:38,670
We'll get e few examples there to see how
to keep our systems nice and clean and

278
00:13:38,670 --> 00:13:40,210
operating smoothly.

279
00:13:40,210 --> 00:13:42,990
Then we wrap up the series
talking about security, and

280
00:13:42,990 --> 00:13:45,240
it's actually a part of system management.

281
00:13:45,240 --> 00:13:47,580
We'll see the firewall, the gatekeeper,

282
00:13:47,580 --> 00:13:50,050
some of the other applications
that Apple builds in.

283
00:13:50,050 --> 00:13:53,650
To keep your computer safe, so that you
don't have to worry about viruses and

284
00:13:53,650 --> 00:13:55,280
all that mess, but the other guys do.

285
00:13:56,390 --> 00:13:59,880
That's the general range of topics
that we're gonna be covering.

286
00:13:59,880 --> 00:14:05,675
Remember that ASCP is focused on Yosemite
itself, on the operating system.

287
00:14:05,675 --> 00:14:09,425
Versus, the ACTC which moves
to the server side and

288
00:14:09,425 --> 00:14:13,615
now starts to get a little more different,
blended services across the network.

289
00:14:13,615 --> 00:14:17,345
Two kind of different areas
that we're gonna jump into.

290
00:14:17,345 --> 00:14:20,992
Well all of that sounds excited and
interesting to you,

291
00:14:20,992 --> 00:14:26,280
then you're in the right place, stay
tuned, our ACSP series is starting next.

292
00:14:26,280 --> 00:14:31,909
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: Before the initial installation of OS X Yosemite, one should do some prep work prior to installing the Yosemite software, like meeting minimum hardware and software requirements, have enough available memory, perform system and firmware updates, and backup data and settings. Viewers will hear extended preparation information and see the process of creating a bootable USB installer in preparation for installing OS X Yosemite.
episodes.title: Getting Prepared

episodes.description: Installing Yosemite as an upgrade or a clean install is something one needs to consider when in different situations. There is also the option of dividing the hardware into partitions, which viewers will also learn the benefits of.
episodes.title: Installing Yosemite

episodes.description: When something goes wrong with the Mac OS, one will need to look into different recovery features. Viewers will hear discussions about the downloadable recovery disk assistant for older operating systems like OS X Lion, the built-in recovery partition that is included in most newer systems like Mavericks and Yosemite, the internet recovery feature, and using the recovery partition found in the USB installation media.
episodes.title: OS Recovery

episodes.description: Once a system is installed, initial configuration will need to be done. Viewers will see how to automate settings through the Profile Manager and move over data from an old console to a new one using the Migration Assistant tool. Viewers will also hear system preferences, network configurations, and the setup assistant be discussed.
episodes.title: Initial Configuration

episodes.description: Managing/ creating user accounts are an important step in starting to configure the Mac OS. Viewers will hear discussions on the capabilities between different user accounts, attributes associated with each account type, different ways to delete those accounts, and ways to restore them.
episodes.title: Managing User Accounts

episodes.description: Not everybody shares their computer, but for those that do, it’s a good idea to create separate user accounts. Viewers will see demonstrations for those who might need to restrict and control the experience of other user accounts in Mac OS through Parental Controls and also hear about other features like Fast User Switching.
episodes.title: Mulitple User Accounts

episodes.description: There are certain things one needs to be aware of when it comes to managing the accounts on a system and the security behind them. Viewers will hear about different ways to secure user information on Mac OS through: setting passwords, the use of keychain encryption, FileVault, and others.
episodes.title: User Account Security

episodes.description: Every Mac has storage attached to it, but additional storage might need to be added to internal storage or through removable media. Viewers will hear discussions on types of storage, various file systems, how to partition a drive's storage, and options for recovering data on a drive and keeping it safe.
episodes.title: File Storage

episodes.description: Encrypting files are a good security measure to protect data from being breached. Viewers will learn about the encryption process behind FileVault and Legacy FileVault, as well as hear how to securely destroy data.
episodes.title: File Encryption

episodes.description: Every aspect of a computer is represented as a file, and file permission is what determines who's allowed to access those files. Viewers will hear extended information about how file permissions work, how they are seen, how they can be modified, ways to correct them, and ways to access them through the Terminal program.
episodes.title: File Permissions

episodes.description: When using a system with multiple users, the need might arise for special file permissions for files shared between users. Viewers will hear about, special permissions for deleting files, ways to repair permissions, and permissions associated with removable media.
episodes.title: File Permissions Part 2

episodes.description: There are times when one might want to have a file in more than one place on a hard drive, but not want more than one copy of the file. Managing files are a good way to keep track of important information that could be buried beneath all the different files a system holds. Viewers will hear discussions on cloning or linking files, making an alias for a file, and managing metadata.
episodes.title: Managing Files Part 1

episodes.description: For one to be able to effectively manage files, one should have the understanding to access a majority of files on a system. Viewers will hear about ways to hide files, manage fonts, and look at hidden system files and folders.
episodes.title: Managing Files Part 2

episodes.description: File archives and images are a way to combine multiple files into one to make them easier to move around and distribute. Viewers will hear discussions on compressing files, creating disk images, and the benefits of using them.
episodes.title: File Archives and Images

episodes.description: When one wants to prevent the possibility of complete data loss in result from a failed drive, one should backup their data. Time Machine is backup software built into Mac OS that makes for an easy solution to keep data safe. Viewers will hear about the process of backing up a hard drive through Time Machine, some of the advanced functionality behind it, and how to restore a system from Time Machine backups.
episodes.title: Time Machine

episodes.description: Applications can do a wide variety of different things and be very helpful to a user, but sometimes applications downloaded outside of the App Store can be less secure to download. Viewers will hear advantages and disadvantages of using the app store, different types of applications, and the process of uninstalling them.
episodes.title: Managing Applications

episodes.description: Every application installed onto Mac OS is going to generate data, so there are some things one should be aware of when it comes to that data. Viewers will hear about the preview functionality behind Quick Look, preserving data through the Autosave feature, and about preference files and how they work.
episodes.title: Application Data

episodes.description: Supporting applications and application features are what allow the useful functions that come with them to run smoothly on a system. Viewers will hear about means of supporting applications like Java and features like iCloud services, VoiceOver, and the Activity Monitor, which are built into Mac systems.
episodes.title: Application Support

episodes.description: Configuring a network connection is important because that's what allows one to share a connection with other computers and connect to the internet. Viewers will hear about basic connectivity to a network, different network protocols, and about wireless networks.
episodes.title: Network Configuration

episodes.description: Network services are the things that one can use across a network once a connection is established. Viewers will hear about all the different things one can use a network for including different iCloud services like Back to My Mac, Find My Mac, and other sharing services featured on a local computer system.
episodes.title: Network Services

episodes.description: Peripheral devices are accessories or devices that can be added on to a Mac that make it expandable like mice and keyboards, cameras, charging devices, printers, and external storage devices. Viewers will hear about peripheral devices and different ways to connect those devices through options like Bluetooth, FireWire, Thunderbolt, USB, and etc.
episodes.title: Peripheral Devices

episodes.description: When a system is not performing right, one should utilize the proper tools and troubleshooting techniques to assess the problem at hand. Viewers will hear about the different options to boot up a Mac and the phases of a system boot in order to implement troubleshooting diagnostics and tactics on a system.
episodes.title: System Troubleshooting
